name: Samara Tree House Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: EXCELLENT*********
reviews.title: the best hotel in samara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were here for five nights.......the best hotel in samara. right on the beach.
reviews.title: Beautiful and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: service was wonderful and we look forward to returning on our next trip to costa rica.
reviews.title: Special hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three nights here with my boyfriend and another couple. There are four "tree houses" right on the beach and two small rooms near the pool. My boyfriend and I ended up in room 6 near the pool. It was quiet with a/c which the tree houses did not have. Although the bed was small, it was comfortable. Breakfast was good and the staff was friendy, low key, and polite. I would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These tree houses are located right on the beach under nice palm trees. It is a small hotel with only 4 big tree houses, 1 ground floor apartment and 1 en-suite room plus pool area. The hotel is nicely set up and creatively decorated. Since we were on a longer backpacking trip, we could only afford the en-suite room on the ground, but that was great too and we could still enjoy all the amenities of the hotel and also the free boogie boards to ride the nice waves! Before we left, we had a look at one of the nice and airy tree houses. We hope to be back soon in order to enjoy one of those great rooms!
reviews.title: Needs some TLC

reviews.text: The Treehouse is a really wonderful place to stay in Samara. The staff there are all very pleasant, and someone is onsite 24 hours a day. Breakfast is included with the cost of your stay, and is a wonderful addition to the experience. There is nothing like fresh fruit and eggs every morning to start out the day. The views are spectacular; from any of the beach apartments there is a clear line to the beach, Isla Chora, and more. My only suggestion would be to add screens to the main windows of the apartments, as during the rainy season, the bugs can really infiltrate your living space. Other than that, I highly enjoyed my time there and will definitely return. In fact, I was the only person in my group who stayed on the beach without air conditioning (everyone else had air) and many were jealous of the beach breezes. Very highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting, will return again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the nicest I've stayed in, and I have done a lot of traveling. It is right on the beach in Samara, an amazing little town. It is built on stilts. Your room has a full kithen, amazing rooms with open air so you can sleep to the ocean's breeze and the sound of the waves. I wouldn't change a thing about this place!
reviews.title: Soooo Beautiful!

reviews.text: The location was amazing. It was on the beach walking distance from many great restaurants/bars, ATMs, and grocery stores. All this said it still had a private paradise feel. The town is off the beaten path a bit so you don't get the annoying herds off amateur vacationers. Breakfast is served at your private poolside patio in the morning with great fresh fruit. Check out their site for photos.
reviews.title: Complete paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights here in Feb 2011. Chose it due to the positive reviews on T.A., and were really glad we did.
reviews.title: Going back next year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't say enough about Esther and the staff- they are all lovely people. They keep the place spotless and all are pleasant and friendly.
reviews.title: A little slice of heaven

reviews.text: We are typical Americans, and we love our Air Conditioning. The beach front "Stilt Houses" do not have A/C, and the large windows facing the beach do not have screens. It was hot, and unbearable to sleep at night. If there were screeens, at least we could have left the windows open. But too many bugs to do this. Rooms also were not the best maintained, and floors were creaky. BUT, the location was superb..next door to the C&C surf school, and the breakfast was great, the staff was great, and the pool was great. if they would just put in window screeens, or better yet Air Conditioning, this would be THE PLACE on Samara. Oh, what a beautiful beach!!!
reviews.title: Best Spot on the Beach, No A/C!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Samara Tree House Inn in mid-August and enjoyed the entire experience. From our admittedly informal perspective of walking the entire beach several times, Tree House Inn appeared to have the classiest appearance of anything we saw. The Inn is only 5 years old, so the cool tree houses look like new. The beach was nicely groomed regularly and the Inn had their own beach chairs.
reviews.title: Great location on the beach!
Simply beautiful
reviews.text: Although we didn't use them, there were grills and sinks in the outdoor area below each tree house unit. Breakfast was delivered to individual tables below the units eachmorning, consisting of a plate of fresh fruit, followed by another plate of fried or scrambled eggs and toast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our unit on the beach had a nice view of the water and was very comfortable, although not air conditioned. Due to an abundance of ceiling fans, oscillating fans and large open windows we were comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Spot Right on the Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, it all boils down to the fact that we'd stay there again. It's a nice place!
reviews.title: Best possible location

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at the Samara Tree House Inn this past week, and had a wonderful time. I didn't know anything about Samara, just that my travel buddy had heard it was a great place to stay on the beach. We drove in at night. The roads to here are quite decent by Costa Rican standards - paved, not too potholed. Definitely take your time to avoid the dogs, wildlife, and farm animals who like to think of the roads as their playground.
reviews.title: I would stay here again in a heartbeat

reviews.text: We stayed in TreeHouse #4, the view of the ocean was fabulous. We spent many blissful hours either on lawn chairs right by the water, or swinging in our two dedicated hammocks. The tree houses are set up so the entire area below the treehouse is your private veranda, complete with 2 hammocks, a BBQ grill (you can get supplies to bbq across the street), a sink, table and chairs (also where breakfast is served).
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire property is in immaculate condition. The pool is beautiful and clean and a nice place to relax after playing in the ocean. There are only six units, and I understand they book quickly, especially in the high season. We were there in the low season and it was still busy most of the time.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but no ac in beach front rooms = hot, hot, hot!

reviews.text: There's a supermarket about two blocks away, and a more casual fish market that Esther can give you directions to (which is a better place to buy fish -- we bought fish and beef at the local supermarket and it was not what we wanted at all. The cute dog that picked us out as soft targets got a great dinner that night).
reviews.title: The most beautiful place on earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Esmerelda, down the street, is often empty but really does serve great, inexpensive meals.
reviews.title: Best Place In Samara

aka: Samara Tree House Hotel Playa Samara
description: Welcome to the Samara Tree House Inn. We offer six luxury tree house style apartments right in the heart of Samara Village. We are located directly ON the beach and in the middle of town, close to numerous activities, shops and restaurants, including surf rentals and lessons next door. These charming tropical hardwood units all have WiFi and are situated amongst beautiful tropical gardens and an idyllic pool with a shallow area for sun tanning while partly submerged in the water. Wake up every morning to breakfast, the sound of the waves, and the cool breeze of the ocean. Don’t walk by and wish you had stayed here. DO stay here!
